oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Bobby Goldsboro Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with the Bobby Goldsboro (performer) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bobby Goldsboro; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Bobby Goldsboro wishes a Happy Holidays radio spot and talks about his bike -- (00:22) Goldsboro holiday spot about Roy Rogers -- (00:38) Goldsboro failed attempt at announcing audiobiography -- (00:49) Goldsboro successful attempt at announcing audiobiography -- (00:56) Goldsboro radio spot announcing his show with Biff Collie and his audiobiography -- (01:16) Goldsboro radio spot announcing his show with Collie and his audiobiography -- (01:27) Goldsboro radio spot announcing how music change his life with Collie and his audiobiography -- (01:42) Goldsboro radio spot announcing his show with Collie and his audiobiography -- (01:51) Goldsboro announces his two hour segment with Collie -- (02:02) Goldsboro announces his two hour segment with Collie -- (02:16) Goldsboro radio spot announcing his show with Collie and his audiobiography -- (02:30) Goldsboro announces the thirty minute mark to begin commercial break -- (02:44) Goldsboro announces the hour mark to begin commercial break -- (02:56) Goldsboro announces the ninety minute mark to begin commercial break -- (3:06) Goldsboro sign off -- (03:17) Goldsboro tells his background information and jokes about his age -- (04:00) Goldsboro talks about being a younger brother -- (04:20) Goldsboro talks about his parents flower shop and dad going off to war -- (04:48) Goldsboro talks about his athletics and his secret boxing and major league baseball -- (07:35) Goldsboro talks about his musical family and his early diversification of music -- (08:25) Goldsboro talks about how he learned songs and jokes to kill time in morning school -- (09:03) Goldsboro talks about being a self-taught guitar player and almost getting a bass by mistake -- (10:16) Goldsboro talks about The Webbs and being at their rehearsals hearing Chet Atkins styling -- (11:45) Goldsboro tells about how he played at an airbase and becoming a singer on the spot -- (13:54) Goldsboro talks about his first song he wrote "The Birmingham Bop" and writing "Wonderful Wonder" -- (14:51) Goldsboro talks about writing poems in school and ideas of major league sports -- (15:47) Goldsboro talks about being signed to a recording contract and being afraid of New York -- (16:45) "See the Funny Little Clown" is discussed as an afterthought made top ten -- (17:20) Goldsboro talks about being in the Roy Orbison band and going to Seattle -- (20:27) Goldsboro talks about Orbison and believing in chance -- (21:18) Orbison's humor is talked about -- (23:02) Goldsboro talks about Orbison's dark glasses as a method of disguise -- (24:27) Goldsboro tells leaving the band as a difficult decision supported by Orbison -- (27:08) Goldsboro talks about doing a show in Detroit and Chicago promotions -- (28:42) Goldsboro talks about his downward trend of his records and its influence of quickly releasing "Honey" -- (29:36) Goldsboro talks about "Honey"'s influence on his expanding role in television -- (30:56) Goldsboro talks about being asked to host the Michael Douglas Show with Cornel Wilde -- (34:37) Collie and Goldsboro talk about his time recording in various foreign languages and the flub in Germany by being stuck with three different ways to pronounce the opening lyric -- (36:45) Goldsboro talks about recording in Paris with no opportunity to see any sites -- (37:26) Collie and Goldsboro talk about his television experience with interviewing actors and preparing for the Tonight Show -- (40:28) Goldsboro talks about the Phil Donahue Show -- (40:45) Goldsboro talked about being on the Mike Douglas Show and their decision to make Goldsboro be known as accident prone and dealing with a peacock -- (43:25) Goldsboro talks about being on a Dick Clark tour and breaking a guitar string on stage leading to his frog voice -- (45:20) Jim Henson is discussed and Goldsboro having worked with puppets -- (46:16) The three years the Bobby Goldsboro show was on the air is discussed -- (48:03) Goldsboro talks about meeting Mac Davis and recording Davis' song -- (40:46) Goldsboro's biggest hobby, bass fishing, is discussed -- (51:12) Goldsboro reminisce about being on the road and playing for cruises -- (53:48) Goldsboro's dreams are joked about
